intro: Senecio rubescens, commonly known as the red stem groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually hairy and grayish-green, while the flowers are yellow with a reddish tinge. Senecio rubescens is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and attractive appearance.
